dt: {bc}to show or establish logical or causal connection between

dt.t: the law {wi}relates{/wi} back to the initial date of decision
the way a child {wi}relates{/wi} to a teacher
can't {wi}relate{/wi} to that kind of music

dt: {bc}to understand and like or have sympathy for someone or something

dt.t: Those who have experienced the same hardship can {wi}relate{/wi}.
characters the reader can easily {wi}relate{/wi} to

pt: {sc}join{/sc} {sc}combine{/sc} {sc}unite{/sc} {sc}connect{/sc} {sc}link{/sc} {sc}associate{/sc} {sc}relate{/sc} mean to bring or come together into some manner of union. {sc}join{/sc} implies a bringing into contact or conjunction of any degree of closeness.

pt.t: {it}joined{/it} forces in an effort to win

pt: {sc}combine{/sc} implies some merging or mingling with corresponding loss of identity of each unit.

pt.t: {it}combined{/it} jazz and rock to create a new music

pt: {sc}unite{/sc} implies somewhat greater loss of separate identity.

pt.t: the colonies {it}united{/it} to form a republic

pt: {sc}connect{/sc} suggests a loose or external attachment with little or no loss of identity.

pt.t: a mutual defense treaty {it}connected{/it} the two nations

pt: {sc}link{/sc} may imply strong connection or inseparability of elements still retaining identity.
{sc}associate{/sc} stresses the mere fact of frequent occurrence or existence together in space or in logical relation.

pt.t: opera is popularly {it}associated{/it} with high society

pt: {sc}relate{/sc} suggests the existence of a real or presumed logical connection.

pt.t: {it}related{/it} what he observed to what he already knew

et: Latin {it}relatus{/it} (past participle of {it}referre{/it} to carry back), from {it}re-{/it} + {it}latus{/it}, past participle of {it}ferre{/it} to carry {ma}{mat|tolerate|}, {mat|bear|}{/ma}
shortdef: to give an account of : tell
to show or establish logical or causal connection between
to apply or take effect retroactively —usually used with back
